raw_infobox.name: Kobe Bryant
raw_infobox.caption: Bryant with the Los Angeles Lakers in 2014
raw_infobox.height_footnote: {{#tag:ref|In 2017, Vanessa Bryant said that Kobe was {{convert|6|feet|4+3/4|in|m|2}} without shoes and {{convert|6|ft|6|in|m|2}} with shoes. In 2006, Bryant said that he was {{convert|6|ft|4|in|m|2}}.{{cite news |last=Mallozzi |first=Vincent |title='Where's Kobe? I Want Kobe.' |date=December 24, 2006 |newspaper=The New York Times |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/12/24/sports/basketball/24cheer.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20211223135007/https://www.nytimes.com/2006/12/24/sports/basketball/24cheer.html?_r=1& |archive-date=December 23, 2021 |url-status=live}} In 2008, he stated he was "probably" {{convert|6|ft|5|in|m}} in shoes.{{cite news |last=Ding |first=Kevin |title=Kobe Bryant's work with kids brings joy, though sometimes it's fleeting |date=January 8, 2008 |newspaper=Orange County Register |url=http://www.ocregister.com/sports/kobebryant-88229-makeawishfoundation-lakers.html |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121125015644/http://www.ocregister.com/sports/kobebryant-88229-makeawishfoundation-lakers.html |archive-date=November 25, 2012 |url-status=live}}|group=lower-alpha|name=height_note}}
raw_infobox.high_school: Lower Merion High School {{avoid wrap|(Ardmore, Pennsylvania)}}
raw_infobox.highlights:
* 5× List of NBA champions (2000–2002, 2009, 2010)
* 2× NBA Finals Most Valuable Player Award (2009, 2010)
* NBA Most Valuable Player Award (2007)
* 18× List of NBA All-Stars (1998, 2000–2016)
* 4× NBA All-Star Game Kobe Bryant Most Valuable Player Award (2002, 2007, 2009{{efn|co-MVP along with Shaquille O'Neal}}, 2011)
* 11× All-NBA Team (2001–2003, 2005–2012)
* 2× All-NBA Team (1999, 2000)
* 2× All-NBA Team (1998, 2004)
* 9× All-NBA Defensive Team (1999, 2002, 2003, 2005–2010)
* 3× All-NBA Defensive Team (2000, 2001, 2011)
* 2× List of National Basketball Association annual scoring leaders (2005, 2006)
* Slam Dunk Contest champion (1997 NBA All-Star Game)
* All-NBA Rookie Team (1996)
* NBA 75th Anniversary Team
* {{Abbr|Nos.|Numbers}} 8 & 24 Los Angeles Lakers#Retired numbers
* Naismith Prep Player of the Year Award (1996)
* Gatorade Player of the Year awards (1996)
* McDonald's All-American Game (1996 McDonald's All-American Boys Game)
* First-team Parade All-America Boys Basketball Team (1996)
* Fourth-team ''Parade'' All-American (1995)

personal_info.high_school: Lower Merion High School {{avoid wrap|(Ardmore, Pennsylvania)}}
